skill.name: enhance-prompt
skill.description: Transforms vague UI ideas into polished, Stitch-optimized prompts. Enhances specificity, adds UI/UX keywords, injects design system context, and structures output for better generation results.
skill.summary: Transforms vague UI ideas into polished, Stitch-optimized prompts with enhanced specificity, design system context, and structured output.
skill.author: google-labs-code

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing prompt engineering guidelines for the Stitch UI generation tool. Static scanner flagged markdown code formatting and UI terminology as security issues. All findings are false positives. The skill has no executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access beyond optional file output, and no external dependencies.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm Detection
high_findings.description: Scanner flagged text strings like 'DESIGN.md' and UI terminology as weak cryptographic algorithms. This is incorrect - the skill contains no cryptographic code.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Term 'DESIGN.md' was misidentified as 'DES' encryption. No cryptographic algorithms present in this documentation skill.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Windows SAM Database Detection
high_findings.description: Scanner misidentified UI component names 'Card' and 'Card Grid' as Windows SAM database references. These are standard UI terminology.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: UI component 'Card' is a standard design element, not Windows security database. Clear from context.

medium_findings.title: False Positive: Ruby/Shell Backtick Execution
medium_findings.description: Scanner flagged markdown backtick formatting as shell command execution. Backticks in markdown are code formatting, not shell execution.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Backticks in documentation format code examples and file paths. No shell or Ruby execution occurs.

low_findings.title: True Positive: Hardcoded Documentation URL
low_findings.description: Line 17 contains a hardcoded URL to official Stitch documentation. This is standard documentation practice and low risk.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: URL points to official Google documentation. No security concern for documentation skill.

low_findings.title: False Positive: System Reconnaissance Detection
low_findings.description: Scanner flagged UI layout terms 'Grid Layout' as system reconnaissance. These are standard design vocabulary.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: UI terminology for page layout, not system information gathering.

content.value_statement: Vague UI descriptions often produce inconsistent results from AI generators. This skill transforms rough ideas into structured, detailed prompts that include design system context, specific component names, and clear page layouts for higher quality outputs.
actual_capabilities: Transforms vague UI descriptions into detailed, structured prompts for Stitch
Adds design system context from existing DESIGN.md files or suggests creation
Replaces generic terms with specific UI component keywords
Applies visual style adjectives and color specifications to prompts
Organizes prompts with numbered page sections and component hierarchy
Provides optional file output for use with other Stitch skills
limitations: Only enhances prompts for Stitch UI generation tool
Does not generate actual UI code or designs
Cannot access external design systems without existing DESIGN.md
Output quality depends on user providing enough initial context

use_cases.title: Transform Vague Ideas into Detailed Prompts
use_cases.description: Users who have a basic UI idea but struggle to express it clearly can provide a simple description like 'make me a login page'. The skill enhances this into a structured prompt with colors, components, and layout specification.
use_cases.target_user: Non-technical users new to AI-assisted design

use_cases.title: Add Design System Consistency
use_cases.description: Users working on multi-page projects can use the skill to ensure all generated pages follow consistent design patterns by extracting and including design tokens from an existing DESIGN.md file.
use_cases.target_user: Design system maintainers and frontend developers

use_cases.title: Improve Failed Generation Results
use_cases.description: When a previous prompt produced unsatisfactory results, users can submit it for enhancement with additional specificity, visual details, and structural clarity to get better outcomes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Enhancement
prompt_templates.prompt: Enhance this prompt for better Stitch results: "{user_prompt_description}"
prompt_templates.scenario: Simple enhancement of a vague UI idea

prompt_templates.title: Design System Enhancement
prompt_templates.prompt: Enhance this prompt using our design system. First check for DESIGN.md, then transform "{user_prompt_description}" with appropriate colors, typography, and component styles.
prompt_templates.scenario: Enhancement with existing design system context

prompt_templates.title: Iterative Improvement
prompt_templates.prompt: The prompt "{original_prompt}" produced poor results. Analyze what is missing and enhance it with better specificity, visual details, and structured sections.
prompt_templates.scenario: Improving a previous generation that did not meet expectations

prompt_templates.title: Feature Addition
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an enhancement prompt to add "{feature_description}" to an existing page. Include location, style specifications, and behavioral details.
prompt_templates.scenario: Adding a specific feature to an existing design

output_examples.output:
A clean, trustworthy login page with a centered form and subtle branding.

**DESIGN SYSTEM (REQUIRED):**
- Platform: Web, Desktop-first
- Theme: Light, minimal, professional
- Background: Clean White (#ffffff)
- Surface: Soft Gray (#f9fafb) for form card
- Primary Accent: Deep Blue (#2563eb) for submit button and links
- Text Primary: Near Black (#111827) for headings
- Text Secondary: Medium Gray (#6b7280) for labels
- Buttons: Subtly rounded (8px), full-width on form
- Cards: Gently rounded (12px), soft shadow for elevation

**Page Structure:**
1. **Header:** Minimal logo, centered
2. **Login Card:** Centered form with email, password fields, "Forgot password?" link
3. **Submit Button:** Primary blue "Sign In" button
4. **Footer:** "Don't have an account? Sign up" link

Add a search bar to the header navigation.

**Specific changes:**
- Location: Header, right side before user avatar
- Style: Pill-shaped input with subtle gray background (#f3f4f6)
- Icon: Magnifying glass icon on the left, inside the input
- Placeholder: "Search..." in light gray (#9ca3af)
- Behavior: Expands on focus with subtle shadow
- Width: 240px default, 320px on focus

**Context:** This is a targeted edit. Make only this change while preserving all existing elements.

best_practices: Provide enough initial context for the skill to make appropriate enhancement decisions
Use the optional DESIGN.md file for multi-page project consistency
Iterate with the skill when initial results do not meet expectations
Be specific about the purpose and target users of the UI you want to generate
anti_patterns: Providing overly vague inputs like 'make it look good' without context
Requesting complex multi-page designs in a single prompt iteration
Ignoring the design system recommendations when working on consistent projects
Skipping iteration when the first enhanced prompt does not produce desired results

faq.question: What is the enhance-prompt skill?
faq.answer: It is a prompt engineering skill for Stitch that transforms vague or basic UI descriptions into detailed, structured prompts that produce better results from AI generators.

faq.question: Does this skill generate actual UI code?
faq.answer: No. This skill only creates enhanced text prompts. The actual UI generation is handled by the Stitch tool based on the enhanced prompts.

faq.question: What is DESIGN.md and why does the skill mention it?
faq.answer: DESIGN.md is a design system file that stores colors, typography, and component styles. The skill can read this file to include consistent design tokens in enhanced prompts for multi-page projects.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with other AI code generators?
faq.answer: This skill is optimized for Stitch and its specific prompt format. The enhanced prompts may work with other generators but are designed for Stitch's expected input structure.

faq.question: How do I improve results when the enhanced prompt does not work?
faq.answer: Use the iterative improvement template to analyze what went wrong and add missing details. Provide more specific context about the desired outcome, platform, and user needs.

faq.question: Does this skill modify any files on my system?
faq.answer: The skill can optionally write enhanced prompts to a file if you specifically request it, but it never modifies existing project files without explicit user instruction.
